RumorFact.Text: There is another Quantum Moon Locator somewhere on Brittle Hollow.
A Nomai named Ilex was curious about a Quantum Moon Locator on Brittle Hollow.
A Nomai named Solanum hoped to visit and inquire about the Quantum Moon Locator on Brittle Hollow.
A Nomai named Ilex provided a set of eyes from the Quantum Moon Locator on Ember Twin.

ExploreFact.Text: A Nomai device in the Tower of Quantum Knowledge, built to track the Quantum Moon's location.
A Nomai named Ilex provided a set of eyes from the Quantum Moon Locator on Ember Twin, to aid another Nomai's pilgrimage to the Quantum Moon.
The locator on Brittle Hollow is more difficult to use to track the Quantum Moon because it was built underground.
The Quantum Moon Locator on Ember Twin has a clear view of the sky, allowing use of the rule of quantum imaging from afar.

RumorFact.Text: A Nomai named Kousa left a scroll in the Hanging City that goes into more detail about the storm shelter.

ExploreFact.Text: Artificial gravity highways that allows one to ascend the Hanging City's districts.
A warp transmitter requires a connected warp receiver to function.
Storm shelters generate a gravity field to protect Nomai in zero-gravity.
The Sunless City contributed to the invention of the storm shelter, allowing the device to autonomously power on and off.
A Nomai named Lami was confused why he was unable to jump as high as he did elsewhere on Brittle Hollow, and was told it was because they were now on the north pole.
Nomai can learn how to jump to greater heights on the Hourglass Twins.

RumorFact.Text: Gravity crystals used to build the Orbital Probe Cannon were sourced from this workshop on Brittle Hollow.
The Nomai on Giant's Deep visited this workshop on Brittle Hollow's equator to inquire about storm shelters activating in the absence of cyclones.

ExploreFact.Text: Gravity crystals were crafted from fragments of Brittle Hollow's crust and stored at this workshop.
An invention called the storm shelter was engineered at this workshop to help Nomai weather storms on their expedition.
Storm shelters are powered by solar panels, not cyclones.
Nomai on Giant's Deep reported some sort of issue with the storm shelter when the sun was directly overhead.

AltText.Text: The solar panels powering the storm shelters are tuned to detect even faint amounts of sunlight, causing storm shelters to activate when the sun is directly overhead.

ExploreFact.Text: All available gravity crystals from this workshop were transported to Giant's Deep to build something called the Inspired.
